alert.note: Alert for Dearborn (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 25 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN DEARBORN...NORTHERN BOONE AND WESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES... At 428 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Burlington, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Florence, Forest Park, Harrison, North College Hill, Cheviot, Villa Hills, Mount Healthy, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Bright, Hidden Valley, Oakbrook, Burlington, Union, Cleves, Shawnee, Taylor Creek, Bridgetown and Miami Heights. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 169 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 16. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 181 and 182. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
